findings.title: Power source weight is not checkpointed
findings.description: Vote manipulation possible due to uncheckpointed power source weight.

findings.title: Unbound Loop with External Calls
findings.description: An unbound loop with external calls can have high gas consumption, potentially preventing some transactions from being executed due to block gas limit.

findings.title: _weight can be set to zero
findings.description: `_weight` can be set to zero which implies unfavourable behavior according to a similar check.

findings.title: Missing Check for Period Existence
findings.description: A check should be added to ensure a period with a given index exists.

findings.title: Implicit Data Types in Checkpointing and ActivePeriod Libraries
findings.description: APIs of the Checkpointing and ActivePeriod libraries can be made more explicit in terms of the supported data types (uint64 for time-like values and uint192 for numeric values). We suggest using exact data types and forcing users of the libraries to acknowledge that by using type casts.

findings.title: MAX_UINT192 Value Exceedance Warning
findings.description: Add a warning to TokenWrapper contract documentation stating that neither totalSupply nor any balance of the token can exceed MAX_UINT192 value.

findings.title: Typo in the word activation.
findings.description: A typo exists in the word 'activation'.

findings.title: Many power sources with the same address can be added
findings.description: Make sure that this is the expected scenario.

findings.title: Function Execution with Disabled Power Source
findings.description: The function can be executed even for a disabled power source, which may lead to unintended behavior.

findings.title: The _aggregateAt function can be temporarily blocked by a malicious power source.
findings.description: A malicious power source can temporarily block the _aggregateAt function.

findings.title: Improper Error Handling
findings.description: Using revert instead of assert can lead to inconsistent code behavior and affect smart contract reliability.
